definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)

sentences.english: That shiftiness was also recognised by those whose money was actually at stake.
sentences.chinese: 那些借錢出來的人同樣識別面相變化。

sentences.english: And, that's the same thing --  as being tangent to the level.
sentences.chinese: 這就和“與等值面相切”說的一樣了。

sentences.english: Their integration and development has a distinct character.
sentences.chinese: 專業村的整合與發展有其獨特的面相。

sentences.english: Tracy pool barrier with the West Peak, Wufeng straight face new pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 連峯壘翠西池西，五峯新亭面相直。

sentences.english: Face reading Qu really sighs for the view to this young.
sentences.chinese: 面相覷，對這位少年真是歎爲觀止。

sentences.english: knees. Jeff and Flora looked /into/ each other’s faces with a look of fright.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫和福羅拉麪面相覷，驚恐不已。

sentences.english: I blended a multitude of human physiognomies to create this plausible simulation.
sentences.chinese: 我混合了很多人種的面相來創造了這個形象。

sentences.english: We looked not know how to answer.
sentences.chinese: 大家面面相覷，不知道該怎麼回答。

sentences.english: Shifty physiognomy, it seems, is independent of these things.
sentences.chinese: 似乎狡詐的面相獨立於這些因素。

sentences.english: For centuries, the Chinese have believed your facial features can reveal truths about your personality.
sentences.chinese: 幾個世紀來，中國人一直相信面相可揭示人的性格。

sentences.english: The guests looked at each other.
sentences.chinese: 賓客們都不禁面面相覷。

sentences.english: We gaze at each other as dumb animals gaze at human beings.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞口無言，像愚笨的動物癡望人類一樣面面相覷。

sentences.english: One of the many faces at Angkor Thom.
sentences.chinese: 吳哥窟裏很多面相中的一個。

sentences.english: All the young mice were silent, and only looked at one another.
sentences.chinese: 所有年輕的老鼠都安靜了下來，大家只是面面相覷。

sentences.english: Jane and Elizabeth looked at each other, and the waiter was told that he need not stay.
sentences.chinese: 吉英和伊麗莎白麪面相覷，便打發那個堂倌走開。

sentences.english: Jasper and I looked at each other.

definition: facial expression of good fortune/joyous and contented look
to tell fortune by reading the subject's facial features
fortune telling based on the subject's face
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
variant of 臉型|脸型, shape of face/physiognomy
sloping eyebrows, formed like character for "eight"
